arma

Class Mat

  • java.lang.Object
    • arma.Mat

  • public class Mat
extends java.lang.Object
    Mat is a (dense) matrix with calls similar to the Armadillo C++ Algebra Library by Conrad Sanderson et al., but is based on DenseMatrix64F from Peter Abeles’ Efficient Java Matrix Library (EJML).
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sebastian Niemann
    See Also:
    Armadillo C++ Algebra Library, Efficient Java Matrix Library

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int n_cols
      The number of columns of the matrix.
      int n_elem
      The number of elements (same as n_rows * n_cols) of the matrix.
      int n_rows
      The number of rows of the matrix.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Mat()
      Creates a new matrix with n_elem = 0.
      Mat(double[][] matrix)
      Creates a new matrix based on a 2d array.
      Mat(int numberOfRows, int numberOfColumns)
      Creates an new zero matrix with n_rows = numberOfRows and n_cols = numberOfColumns.
      Mat(Mat matrix)
      Creates a new matrix by copying the provided matrix.

      • Mat

        public Mat(int numberOfRows,
   int numberOfColumns)
        Creates an new zero matrix with n_rows = numberOfRows and n_cols = numberOfColumns.
        Parameters:
        numberOfRows - The number of rows of the matrix.
        numberOfColumns - The number of columns of the matrix.
        See Also:
        zeros(int, int)

      • Mat

        public Mat(Mat matrix)
        Creates a new matrix by copying the provided matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix to be copied.

      • Mat

        public Mat(double[][] matrix)
        Creates a new matrix based on a 2d array.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The 2d array with the structure double[rows][columns].
